intro: Monadenium goetzei, commonly known as the Goetze's monadenium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with fleshy, cylindrical leaves. Monadenium goetzei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
